name: Hampton Inn & Suites Downtown Vancouver

reviews.text: This Hampton Inn is located slightly off-centre, but is still an easy walk from the tourist sights and business district in Vancouver. Several restaurants and convenience stores are located close-by. The worst inconvenience was that the hotel is not on the circuit of the Airport Bus.
reviews.title: Very pleasant city-centre hotel and great value

reviews.text: The hotel is modern with very pleasantly furnished and fully-equipped rooms.
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay in Downtown Vancouver

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The complimentary breakfast had a wide choice, including a daily hot option. The breakfast area, though compact, never seemed overwhelmed. Complimentary internet access was also available.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: There is a restaurant attached that provides evening meals. The food was okay, but the service was poor and I wouldn't rate it highly.
reviews.title: Highly recommended

reviews.text: Dates of Stay-25-26 October 2008 (1 night) in Room #407
reviews.title: Loved the Hampton

likes.liked: — The good room and friendly staff

reviews.text: The staff went above and beyond to make my stay special. The room was excellent and I had everything I needed. Breakfast was fresh and very comprehensive. I will definitely be back and recommend this hotel, this is my second trip.
reviews.title: Excellent service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This Hampton has a great location downtown in Vancouver. We got a one bedroom suite and it was nicely equipped though the living room furniture was dated and the hide-a-bed not very comfortable to sit on. Breakfast was good. A large bowl of fresh fruit was the highlight.
reviews.title: Short but sweet stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed two nights at Hampton Inn & Suites Downtown Vancouver. The room was nice, but small, almost "London size". The surroundings was quiete noisy, but for now the construction is done....Breakfast area is small, but anyway space for everybody. The area has a lot of restaurants of all kinds. Around 4 blocks from the hotel, there is 2 or 3 streets full of bars and restaurants of all kinds. A good walk, and you are in Stanley park - a must for a day walk in Vancouver. Gym is located at top floor with fantastic view as a bonus.
reviews.title: Small room and construction area
Great location and great hotel
reviews.text: This was a great hotel to stay at in downtown Vancouver. Rooms were modern, fresh and comfortable. The breakfast was awesome and lots to choose from. The service was top notch and the location was great. Within walking distance to the shopping district and sky train. I will definitely stay at this property again.

The view from the top of the roof was amazing, one can see the BC Place. The hotel itself is close to transportation, and on Robson street, so one can get some shopping done. There is construction next door of another hotel so that might be noisy. The room was clean, the breakfast items were plentiful and similar to other Hamptons Inn experiences. The bottled water and the umbrella in the rooms were a good thing to have.
reviews.title: Good location, close to multiple Skytrain lines, clean, good view
Liked the hotel, hated the "private tax"
reviews.text: We stayed at Hampton Inn and Suites Vancouver for 5 nights in the middle of October, 2008. We enjoyed the stay a great deal.

The hotel was in excellent shape, despite the fact that it looks to be around 20 years old. Our accommodation was a large, one-bedroom king suite on the 14th floor. It was light, bright and very spacious. The outlook, North-West along Robson Street, wasn’t anything to write home about, but we weren’t there particularly for the view.
reviews.title: Great hotel in great location

reviews.text: Everything in the suite was spotless, from the kitchen (equipped with a microwave oven, a dishwasher and a refrigerator, but no stove) through the bedroom and living room to the spacious bathroom.
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay

reviews.text: The suite was equipped with two large television sets, and there was adequate lighting for activities during the evenings. The king bed was excellent. There was an adequate supply of high-quality towels and toiletries in the bathroom.
reviews.title: Great hotel stay

likes.liked: — Cleanliness, customer service level, business service offerings and price

reviews.text: The kitchen was fully equipped with cutlery, crockery, microwave cooking dishes and a variety of other implements. Perfect if (like us) you wanted to do a bit of cooking “at home” after a long time on the road.
reviews.title: This is the place to stay!

reviews.text: We booked this hotel because of the good reviews on Tripadvisor. For us on a holiday from Europe it is very hard to understand why this hotel gets so excellent reviews.
reviews.title: Average hotel not centrally located

likes.disliked: — The chaotic breakfast buffet that was included.

reviews.text: It is located close to BC Place Stadium but far away from the shops, restaurants and sights in central parts of downtown Vancouver. There is a lot of construction work going on around the area but also besides that this area was far from the Skytrain station and it wasnt always a pleasant walk to get down here from shops and restaurants downtown. The area feels a bit unsafe.
reviews.title: excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel in it self is modern but nothing special a standard average good quality hotel.
reviews.title: Exceptional service!

reviews.text: After searching for a reasonably priced hotels in Vancouver , I decided on the Hampton Inn. It was perfect. The hotel staff could not have been friendlier or more helpful. The rooms were good sized and very clean. The location was great (once we figured out where we were!!). The continental breakfast was great. The hotel even provides snack bags for those that have to leave early before breakfast is ready. (be advised that if the apple in the bag does not have a "sticker" on it you cannot bring it through US customs). There were 3 other couples in our party and everyone was happy with the accomodations and hotel services. (they booked all of our airport taxi's and they were there promptly as promised). There is a great restaurant two blocks from the hotel called Rosie's. It was so good we ate there two nights. This hotel is definitely a great Vancouver "buy"!!!
reviews.title: Loved the Hampton Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here after our airline caused us to miss our cruise ship. We were depressed when we got to the Hampton but the staff there were very sympathetic and extremely helpful.
reviews.title: Good value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was great, the breakfast was very nice, certainly enough to eat, and the staff unfailingly courteous and helpful. Mark the Bellman is a font of local information, he can help you with anything.
reviews.title: Well run hotel

reviews.text: The free shuttle to places like Stanley Park (you have to come back on your own) is also quite welcome. The rest of downtown is a brisk walk away. This will be our number one hotel in Vancouver for future visits.
reviews.title: Loved the free breakfast! Big money saver

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Front desk manager is focused on customer service.
reviews.title: number 1 for a reason

likes.liked: — staff in particular Stacey, breakfast and the general cleanliness

reviews.title: Good quality hotel
reviews.text: This hotel is a good quality one in downtown Vancouver.
Comfortable rooms, acceptable breakfast (free of charge) and good service. Very useful garage.
reviews.title: Nicest Hampton Inn!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However no apparent sign of HH level recognition.
reviews.title: Great hotel, Great service

reviews.text: No bath/shower gel provided: they had a bad quality product and decided to stop providing it! OK but they should provide another one...
reviews.title: Fabulous hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Quiet hotel: excellent for recovering from jet lag!
reviews.title: Fantastic!

likes.liked: — Price; staff; free shuttle service to the cruise pier and Downtown locations; complimentary hot & cold breakfast

reviews.text: My son and I stayed here for 2 nights. We were in Vancouver for a Canucks game. The hotel is only 2 short blocks from the Stadium/Chinatown sky train station, and you walk right past Rogers Arena and B.C. Place Stadium. The we had a 1 bedroom suite on the 12th floor (with free wifi). It was very spacious, with a very comfortable king size bed and pullout couch. 2 tvs, full size fridge, dishwasher, and 2 burner hot plate with the cupboards filled with all the dishes or popcorn bowls you could need. Free National Post each morning at your door....The room had a doorbell (my son loved that), an umbrella in the closet and an in room safe. The 16th floor has spectacular views. It is also where the spa/gym are. There is a 9 person hot tub, although I'm sure it would fit 15, treadmill, elliptical, stationary bike, free weights as well as weight machines. Foosball table, 2 tvs, leather seating, Sauna, and (according to my son) The most fabulous thing a hotel could ever have.....a Ping Pong Table! Did I mention there was coin operated laundry up there too! I like to use the stairs when I go to hotels, and I did here too...only to discover that some of the floors ...the doors are locked once you're in the stairwell. I had to go 4 - 5 flights down to get onto a floor with a door that was open....so skip the stairwell and use the elevator. Elevators are operated with your room key, so that was nice to know that not just anyone could wander into the hotel and up to any floor they choose. There was a free breakfast each morning till 10. Standard stuff, bagels/bread, cold cereal, fruit, pastry, one hot plate of eggs/sausage, choice of juices/milk oatmeal with toppings, and waffles. Wasn't spectacular, but worth going to save on eating out. There was a small store off the lobby with snacks and souvenirs,and a hair salon. Overall, it was a great weekend away with my son, nice and quiet. One last thing, we collect Hilton Honor points...turns out you cannot collect them if you book through a 3rd party like Expedia, Travelocity, Airmiles...anything like that. So if you want those points book through the hotel reservation system.
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.text: We had a great stay in a very clean room. The location to Rogers arena is incredible. We would definitely stay again. Highly recommend this hotel for the concert goer/ sports fan while in Vancouver. Great value
reviews.title: A great location for a Concert

reviews.text: The rooms are the cleanest. Complimentary breakfast simply awesome and the best. I truly enjoyed my stay. The overall ambiance is second to none. What an incredible first experience I had. I will definitely recommend Hampton to my co-workers, family, and friends. My favorite part are the white linens and assurance that the bed cover is washed after each guest. This is very comforting to know.
reviews.title: Room and stay at Hampton

reviews.text: I love this hotel. It is located right across from B.C. Place Stadium and close to Robson Street and shops/restaurants. There is a wonderful roof top game room including fitness center and spa. We enjoyed our King Suite and felt like we were at home with all of the amenities.
reviews.title: Hampton Inn Vancouver B.C.

reviews.text: My son and I stayed here Nov.22-24 for a concert and hockey game. This location is perfect for that. The view was amazing at night because we faced BC Place (room 1507) and it was lit up and looked great. The room was spotless and the beds were very comfortable. The breakfast was very good and easily held us over until lunch. One morning we decided to go to the aquarium and when we asked which was the easiest way to get there, they offered to give us a ride in the shuttle because he was available. Walked back to hotel after we were done at aquarium (which was fantastic) and stopped at Cactus Club which was a welcome break. So many shops and restaurants within walking distance plus there's a 7-11 on Robson for that late night snack. The only complaint I have is that we took the train from the airport to downtown and once we got off it was hard to figure out which way hotel was as there are no instructions on their web site. However, with the smart phone maps and asking a few people we got there with no real problem. We will stay here again 100%.
reviews.title: great location

reviews.text: The room is spacious and clean, but the furnishing is quite dated, given the room rate. Our reception at the desk was not exactly warm when we arrived on a snowy, quiet day. The location is ideal if you are a hockey fan (as it is right next to the BC Place, the stadium), but not for shoppers even though it is on Robson Street. In fact, the neighborhood struck us as somewhat seedy. The suites do not have a bathroom that opens into the living area, and so if you have more than a couple in the party it is not an ideal situation. There were two computers available in the lobby and you must obtain an access code to use one at 30 minutes at a time. On the days when I stayed there I had to compete each morning with two small small kids who used the computers, in the words of their own parents, to kill time.
reviews.title: Overrated

reviews.text: Our family has just returned from an overnight stay at the Hampton Inn (part of the Hilton brand) in downtown Vancouver. This is probably the 3rd time we have stayed there and have always had a wonderful experience. This time was different though! Our hotel room was right by the elevator and because of distraction, didn't check that our door was properly closed when we left to watch the Canucks play the Senators. We had used the "hockey parent' strategy of leaving the door open with the latch so that our kids could come and go without us having to get up to answer the door...only we left the hotel!! We headed out at 5 pm and returned around 11 pm to find a message on the phone saying that our room had been left unlocked...and to check the room to see if anything was missing. Everything was still in the room...even the laptop.
reviews.title: Extremely Safe Hotel!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thank goodness a staff member does a sweep of each floor several times in the evening. As other reviewers have mentioned the hotel is very secure...a room card for swiping is needed to access the rooms by elevator. I appreciated that in the past, but now...even more.
reviews.title: Friendly and accommodating

likes.liked: — Secure Parking, Close to GM and BC Place, Breakfast.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast was great and just what we needed before making the trek back up the Coquihalla highway.
reviews.title: Great hotel!

likes.liked: — The room was nice and clean.

reviews.text: I can't say thank you enough to the staff who made our stay complete. They were friendly and kind...and that was before our unlocked door fiasco! As always, the rooms are very clean and immaculate. It is a great hotel that is really close to GM Place and BC Place. It is within walking distance of the downtown core as well.
reviews.title: Great hotel in downtown Vancouver

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is an excellent hotel in an unfortuate position down in the center of Vancuover right beside the football stadium. When there are no games on, it is easy to walk to the center of everything, and the staff of th hotel are excellent at helping you to decide what to do. When the games are on..hmm!
reviews.title: Nice place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed just one night at the Hampton Inn Downtown. Service was excellent throughout; very helpful staff. Room was spacious, clean and very comfortable with a good size bathroom.
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were disappointed with the breakfast; the cold items were O.K., but not a great choice, but the hot items were barely edible, especially the fried eggs which were so overcooked that they were like rubber.
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Free internet access for hotel guests was very welcome. Secure car parking.
reviews.title: Our first trip to Canada

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only bad experience was the location. The hotel is at the top end of Robson Street so is some way from the main attractions of Vancouver. It was very quiet (admittedly it was late Sunday afternoon when we arrived and we didn't go out until early Sunday evening) and we didn't feel comfortable. It was virtually deserted except for beggars/homeless people - we were approached by a beggar as soon as we stepped outside the hotel and by a few more in the space of a few hundred yards. Because of this we went into the first restaurant we found (Rosie's) and after our meal, went straight back to the hotel. On reflection, maybe we should have got a taxi from the hotel to a more central location.
reviews.title: Pre Cruise Destination

likes.disliked: — Firm bed, but that's personal preference

reviews.title: 5 Days in Vancouver
reviews.text: My family and I spent five days in Vancouver, staying at the Hampton Inn and Suites downtown. The hotel was above average in terms of cleanliness and service, and the daily breakfast was more than adequate. The location isn't bad, considering the price, and the free shuttle service to downtown and the docks was very convenient. (note- the shuttle is one- way only; you make your own way back to the hotel.) Certain areas of the city should be avoided because of the homeless element- Hastings Street (anytime) and Granville ( at night- due to the seedy entertainment district). The main shopping area downtown is very nice, and the Gastown area should not bbe missed. After taking a day trip to Victoria, our opinion is to spend more time there and less in Vancouver proper if possible.

Stayed here for three nights beginning May 27, 2007. I was in town to see the POLICE in concert & wanted a hotel from which I could just walk to the GM Place venue. This was the PERFECT location just across the street. Hotel is definitely 3 stars, maybe more. Rooms are large with wonderful beds. Hotel serves a wonderful breakast in a lovely breakfast area with multiple papers available in the morning to take for free. The Hotel is within walking distance of a local riverfront casino & also the main shopping area of vancouver. Very quiet rooms, Very Clean. Paid $179/night for sat, sun & mon nights. I'd stay here again without hesitation. It's about a 6-7 minute cab ride from the cruiseship terminal too.
reviews.title: Walking On The Moon

reviews.text: First of all, the location is first class. If you're going to GM Place or BC Place Stadium, you're literally a 2 minute walk away. The hotel is also located directly on Robson street so you're a 2 minute walk away from Vancouver's equivalent of Rodeo Drive. For those locations that might take a 10 or 15 minute walk like the Granville Island autobus or Stanley Park, the hotel provides a complimentary shuttle...it goes anywhere downtown. Oh, and the hotel also provides complimentary bike rentals; riding the oceanside bike path's are a must!
reviews.title: The reviews are all true...great hotel!
we loved this hotel
reviews.text: The hotel itself is wonderful...the rooms, the staff, everything! The rooms are spacious and come with everything you could possibly need (including enough pillows for about 8 people). Wireless internet is included with each room. The room service is reasonably priced, has a good selection and arrives promptly.

The breakfast is a very high-end continental. Lots of choices from cereals to pastries to fruits to yogurts to waffles...on and on. You can also get a 'breakfast to go' bag if you're in a hurry in the morning with some fruit, a muffin and a bottle of water. Great idea.
reviews.title: Wonderful gem, just on the edge of everything

reviews.text: As I always use Trip Advisor if I am prebooking I only choose hotels / B&B's that review well. Hence my my scores are usually high, suggesting that I am easliy satisfied. That is far from the truth as we like good quality and value for money and thankfully using TA we get that..
reviews.title: Excellent choice

reviews.text: We had two nights at this hotel in early June and can see why it so highly rated by TA members. Nothing was too much trouble, check in was excellent, rooms/bathrooms on 4th floor were spacious, very clean, comfortable, welcoming bed linen and secure. Umbrellas were available to use. Breakfast was more than adequate, internet was easy and quick and the views from the 16th floor are stupendous. We ate dinner in the attached restaurant and had a very pleasant meal.
reviews.title: Great!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have no problems in recommending this hotel to anyone and will return if we visit Vancouver again.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel for 1 night prior to our cruise. We all wish we would have stayed longer so we could have explored Vancouver a bit more. The hotel was in a good area and within walking distance to alot of shopping, restaurants, etc. BC place right across the street.
reviews.title: Nice hotel for the money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was nice size, comfortable bed, roomy bathroom with good lighting (important to me), breakfast was complementary and OK for me, very friendly and helpful staff.
reviews.title: Great Security

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This property is in a great location and it is in walking distance to most areas in the downtown area - BC Place, Rogers Arena, Yaletown, False Creek, Downtown Shopping etc. etc.
reviews.title: Great Location.

reviews.text: My wife and I had a King room - the room was nice and big and came complete with a desk, chair & ottoman, microwave and a fridge.
reviews.title: As usual a great stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The top floor exercise room is large and there's a good variety of equipment - there's even table tennis and great decks overlooking the city.
reviews.title: Great Sleep!

reviews.text: Breakfast was good although depending on when you are there, it can get a bit crowded.
reviews.title: Another great stay at the Hampton!

reviews.text: Parking is quite reasonable ($19/night) but depending on your vehicle, it can be a little tight down there.
reviews.title: Average hotel, average price, below average service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent location, a superior breakfast compared to other Hampton Inns I have stayed at, don't forget(we did) about the 10% discount if eating next door at Frankie's Italian kitchen, which was good, the best, most extensive collection of newspapers I have seen at a hotel, very clean room, comfortable beds.
reviews.title: Also in town for a Heart concert
Weekend away!!
reviews.text: We were in town for the Heart concert, had never stayed before.the staff were friendly. quick check in, the hotel was clean, beautiful rooms, we had a jetted tub in the room which was nice after a night out! The breakfast the next morning was excellent, lots of choices and very fresh! We will look forward to another stay again!

I have stayed at the hampton for nearly 4 years now for both business and pleasure and hadn't had a bad experience ever! The staff is always pleasant and professional. I would strongly recommend staying here. I always feel safe and the rooms are always well taken care of. I am also a hilton honours member so during my business trips i collect points which i use on my personal trips. I'm within walking distance of everything downtown and if the weather isn't the best for hiking there is a shuffle service as well!So all i can say is go try a visit and i'm positive you will enjoy the stay and want to book another visit with the hampton.
reviews.title: Home away from home

reviews.text: We chose this hotel for its proximity to downtown events we wanted to attend. As ladies traveling without our husbands, we were willing to pay a bit more to be in a safe and convenient location. We were completely satisfied: we felt safe and it was convenient. In addition, the entire hotel staff was extremely accommodating of our every request. We would stay here again and recommend this hotel to others.
reviews.title: Completely satisfied

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very convenient location. Had an amazing corner suite with Jacuzzi tub and floor to celling windows. Welcome back card and candies were delivered to my room. Breakfast was hot and had lots of choices. Hot tub on top floor was a treat. Thank you Sameer for getting me a room up high. we will defiantly
reviews.title: Great Stay!
Great place
reviews.text: We stayed here for 2 days prior to our cruise and then another 2 days after the cruise. The staff welcomed us back like we were old friends, we received a card and chocolates, delivered to our room as a thank you from the hotel. It was a wonderful surprise.
The bed was very comfortable, room was very clean and the staff were wonderful, ready to help in any way they could.
reviews.title: Loved this hotel!

likes.liked: — The front desk staff and the overall accommodations
likes.disliked: — Only one computer with internet service which you have to pay to use

reviews.text: I have only one thing on the negative side to say and that is that the room did not have a kettle, we had to ask the front desk for one, unfortunately they did not have one available so we used the microwave to make a cup of tea. Not a big deal if you are a coffee drinker but annoying if you only drink tea.
reviews.title: Excellent value, great service

reviews.text: I would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Just right for overnite

reviews.text: After a week's cruise in Alaska, this hotel was the icing on the cake! The front desk staff was helpful in every way...from directing us to good restaurants and areas in the city to making sure our every need was met. The rooms are spacious and clean, and the beds were wonderful. We liked having a small refrigerator, microwave, and sink in the "kitchen" part of the room, and appreciated the daily complimentary bottles of water. Although we rented a car for the 3 days we were there, the hotel is withing walking distance to many areas of downtown Vancouver. We felt safe (though we saw several panhandlers and vagrants many places in the area), and the hotel is very secure (both in their parking garage and in getting to our floor in the hotel). The continental breakfast was above average, and although there was only one computer with internet access (for a nominal charge), it was easy to use. We have already recommended this hotel to a family member who will be visiting Vancouver soon. It was great!
reviews.title: Great base for downtown Vancouver, and beyond

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is an excellent hotel & everything I could have asked for as the first hotel we stayed in as part of a two week break in Canada.
reviews.title: Excellent Downtown Hotel

reviews.text: The hotel is a $30 taxi ride from the airport & is situated at the southern edge of downtown. The hotel staff are extremely helpful & genuinely friendly. They had paper maps we could take away & were knowledgeable about the city.
reviews.title: Almost perfect

likes.liked: — Large room, well appointed and maintained

reviews.text: The room was modern and contained all the facilities I was expecting & many more besides. The bedding was of high quality, the bathroom modern with a powerful shower & there was a handy kitchenette area. Also plenty of storage space, a desk with LAN broadband and an easy chair.
reviews.title: Excellent Lodging Option in Vancouver, BC

likes.liked: — Cleanliness of room, bedding, and bath linens

reviews.text: Breakfast was included in the rate of c.$160 inc taxes & whilst being quite basic (paper plates etc) there was everything I wanted – fresh fruit salad, pastries, some hot food, coffee etc. It was all pretty high quality, low hassle & the staff were friendly.
reviews.title: Loved my stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were jet lagged most of the time (8 hours time difference from the UK) so the on demand videos came in useful & the room/area was quiet the whole time so we could sleep from early evening onwards.
reviews.title: Great value

aka: Hampton Inn & Suites Downtown Vancouver Hotel
description: The Hampton Inn & Suites by Hilton is conveniently located on Robson Street near Yaletown, Rogers Arena and the newly renovated BC Place. Complimentary amenities include breakfast, wifi, bottled water, downtown shuttle service and loaner bicycles. Whether it's a hotel room with a microwave and refrigerator or a one bedroom suite with full kitchen, we offer a variety of comfortable beds for your stay in Vancouver. A member of the Hilton Family of Hotels, the Hampton Inn & Suites by Hilton offers both the corporate and the leisure traveler award-winning accommodation at affordable prices.
